Biography

UC SANTA BARBARA

2024

Appeared in 13 games for the Gauchos, making one start … Walked twice, scored two runs and stole a base in 13 plate appearances on the season … Made his Gaucho debut as a defensive replacement in the season opener at Campbell (Feb. 16) … Recorded his first career walk and stolen base on Feb. 17 at Campbell … Made his first career start on Feb. 18 at Campbell. HIGH SCHOOL

A three-year letterwinner at North Marion High School … Two-time Tri Valley League Player of the Year … Three-time All-State First Team selection … Three-time Tri Valley League Champion … Finished in the top four in the state all three years. PERSONAL

Born March 4, 2004 in Redding, Connecticut … Grew up in Canby, Oregon … Son of Tonya and Patrick DeAngelis … Has an older sister, Sophia … Majoring in Economics at UC Santa Barbara … Plans to pursue a career as an investment banker if not in professional baseball … Roots for the Las Vegas Raiders and Kansas City Royals … Lists Lorenzo Cain and Robinson Cano as his favorite athletes … Enjoys surfing, listening to music, enjoying nature and reading in his free time … Never Finished by David Goggins and Genius Foods by Max Lugavere are his favorite books … Lists Goggins and Stephen King as his favorite athletes … Listens to Hunny … Watches Dark and Code Geass … Lists hitting his first home run as his favorite sports moment.
